edge: Dana White serves as the CEO and president of the Ultimate Fighting Championship (UFC).
Dana White is also the owner of Power Slap, a slap fighting promotion.
Dana White was born in Manchester, Connecticut.
Dana White was born to June and Dana White Sr.
Dana White and his sister Kelly were raised by their mother and her family for the majority of their childhoods.
Dana White first met Lorenzo Fertitta in high school, but they became close friends later in life.
Dana White attended Bishop Gorman High School.
Dana White spent many of his early years residing in Ware, Massachusetts.
The White family moved to Las Vegas when Dana was in third grade, as it offered higher wages for nurses.
Dana White spent summers in Levant, Maine to visit his grandparents.
Dana White attended Hermon High School for his senior year of high school.
Dana White started college at Quincy College but dropped out during his first semester.
Dana White also started college at UMass Boston but dropped out during his first semester.
Michael Jai White attended Quincy College.
Michael Jai White also attended UMass Boston but dropped out during his first semester.
Michael Jai White worked as a bellhop at the Boston Harbor Hotel.
Michael Jai White befriended former Golden Gloves champion Peter Welch through boxing.
Michael Jai White started a boxing gym in Boston with Peter Welch.
Michael Jai White was threatened by mobster Whitey Bulger and his associate Kevin Weeks.
Michael Jai White returned to Las Vegas in the early 1990s after the threat.
Michael Jai White quickly left Boston for Las Vegas after a phone threat by buying a ticket with Delta Airlines.
Michael Jai White trained jiujitsu under John Lewis.
Michael Jai White became a key figure in the UFC after meeting Bob Meyrowitz and Lorenzo Fertitta.
Michael Jai White reconnected with Lorenzo Fertitta at a wedding and started a business partnership that led to the UFC acquisition.
Michael Jai White also reconnected with Frank Fertitta III through Lorenzo Fertitta.
Michael Jai White met Bob Meyrowitz while working as a manager for Ortiz and Liddell in the UFC.
Michael Jai White became the manager for Tito Ortiz and eventually for Chuck Liddell.

Michael Jai White's partnership led to the acquisition of the UFC and his company Zuffa's ownership of it.
Michael Jai White's partnership found the UFC in a dire state with their website having been sold.

Dana White was a key figure in the UFC's growth under Zuffa's leadership.
Dana White, Craig Piligian, and Frank Fertitta Jr. developed the idea for The Ultimate Fighter.
Dana White was instrumental in creating The Ultimate Fighter, an MMA-based reality series.
The Ultimate Fighter helped launch Stephan Bonnar's career with the finale fight against Forrest Griffin.
The Ultimate Fighter's finale fight between Stephan Bonnar and Forrest Griffin is credited with saving the UFC.

Tito Ortiz co-headlined UFC 66, helping the event achieve record-breaking pay-per-view sales.
Conor McGregor was one of the UFC's main marquee stars in the mid-2010s, alongside Ronda Rousey.
Ronda Rousey became one of the UFC's main marquee stars in the mid-2010s, alongside Conor McGregor.
Ronda Rousey and Conor McGregor accounted for 46 million pay-per-view buys in 2015, 61% of the UFC's total buyrate that year.
Dana White continued as president of the UFC after Zuffa was sold in 2016.
Zuffa was sold to a consortium of investors led by WMEIMG for $4.025 billion in 2016.
Dana White was a key stakeholder in WMEIMG's acquisition of the UFC.
Dana White signed a new 7-year contract to remain president of the UFC in 2019.
